review: i have tried twice now to play the game and the planet screen makes me motion sick with the planet rotating under the plant build screen it is constant fast motion and it eventually makes me motion sick i know its stupid but it is the reason i play this type game rather then 3d games so i cant really play it so i cant recommend it

total mess that made the studio bankrupt   get star ruler 1 with galactic armoury mod latest version has more bugs then older version of the mod so might want to use a older mod version of ga if you like me have a 100 lockup rate with the latest version
one of the best 4x games ive ever played
best rts 4x game that has multiplayer
it just has that spark that makes the game fun
whoops shouldve reviewed this years ago when it might have mattered  fun and unique 4x not just yet another attempt at cloning moo

maybe im just not good at this game but no matter what i do the ai is always head of me when it comes to fleet strength and i cannot keep up no matter what i do as a result every game of this ive played has ended in stagnation  i really wanted to like this game because it has really fun diplomacy and the supply chain system is interesting but ai thats impossible to go up against is a huge negative for me in any strategy game
star ruler 2 is the best 4x game ever made especially its diplomatic system its brilliant and to this day no one else copied it
ive played this game for 4000 hours what have i to say                                      i need to touch some grass
meh

the game is not bad itself just as many reviewers said it has no soul the mechanics are interesting but it just does not feel that you are a ruler of a star empire the world just feels lifeless and artificial  i would strongly recommend at least to try this game to see whether you will like it also check this great review httpssteamcommunitycomidd996mrecommended282590 however this game is definitely not for me to invest further because i just cannot immerse in it
i really like this game  but too many crashes
its ok
while other 4x games might be more addictive this one is the most fun and interesting i have played must have played like 80 hours before i finally bought it on steam
goot gme
such a shame that this ip flew under the radar and never got the recognition it deserved
star ruler 2 is a very complex game but once you get the hang of the mechanics it is a very fun and rewarding game plus space explosions 810 would buy again

i found the interface very difficult to get on with information you need to manage your empire is not presented very well also it gets confusing with lines of import and export of resources everywhere and difficult to keep up with whats happening in your empire very easy to lose track of whats going on

if you like star ruler 1 dont get this just enjoy the first game in all its glory i got the second game right after it came out and i gave it several attempts to enjoy still a no go for me i will always go back to star ruler 1
stellaris can go blow a black hole up its own singularity

underrated and overshadowed 4x game some pretty unique and interesting systems lots of good stuff in the workshop and a nice blend between realtime and turnbased gameplay diplomacy and ship design systems in particular are very cool
its good
maybe the best battle oriented space 4x out there it certainly has the greatest modding potential alhough unfortunately unrealized

very complex very complicated and very time consuming to learn assuming i will one day  but an enjoyable take and well thought out from what ive seen worth the money and something ill come back to  feels like ai war but with more developed 4x elements
excellent game shame it never really took of like it should have but id highly recommend this if youre into realtime with pause 4x games

real interesting strategy game far different than many of these 4x or strategy games its an older game and has moments that shows its age but really cool economy system and huge sandbox ship builder in which you can import other poeples designs wish we got a star ruler 3
sadly an under appreciated gem there are issues but the amount of choice in this game made me love it
the scope of imagination in this game is awesome you can destroy the galaxy eat stars subjugate aliens make ringworlds that span an entire orbit heaps of good shit
very unique space strategy game

this plays much more like a worker placement board game than a moo2 clone most planetary building is done automatically and depends on whatever types of resources that planet happens to be importing the diplomacy system is straightup a card game and has very powerful effects including being able to annex planets or entire systems   i would definitely recommend playing some practice games against passive ais to get the hang of the resource importexport system

verry realistic graphics has game and is open source also game is worth the price planets look good can export and import goods you can also design your ships build buildings on planet and stations explore anomalies and fight the ai this game was take me a lot of time i played time make short and i like this my most liked spacegame  i recommend game for play and buy
enjoyable

the basic system of planetupgrading is really good allows you to scale up and up but with critical resources that the whole pyramid depends on lose a critical resource and you start a cascading collapse its a really great imperial dynamic  the combat system is actually really interesting and detailed but the battles are usually so massive and theres so little information feedback that it takes forever to understand why some designs work and others dont
yep
quite unfortunate that the studio behind this title has shut down it has innovative concepts and should have been far more popular than it has been
good game runs smoothly
the game has some interesting and bold mechanics i like it

love the star ruler games  this one differed from the first in several respects but kept allot of the core and adds allot of polish  a couple changes to the format make the approach a little different at points but they both run out awesome  very challenging until you perfect your angle and finding you niche and beating 9 or 10 ai is all the more rewarding for the labor  awesome game

i will admit that this was my breakout game for 4x games  unless its the civ series massive army turnbased games have always been a turnoff for me  i am very happy i found this game and other like it now  the required focus and decision making in direct response to another players actions is thrilling
an enjoyable little 4x
fun making your own ships and what notshort gameplay on yt will help get starteda constant game i comeback toi do recommend
absolute gem of a game  truly unique  you wont really find anything like this out there extremely high replayability

a very hidden gem in the strategy game genre has its flaws and blemishes but the greatest part of this game is the ship designer which is one of the best and most unique designers i have ever seen the game has been dead for a long time and updates have stopped planetary resources serve only to upgrade other planets resources or to produce labour which is the main resource of the game being used to build buildings ships stations etc 810
amazing but a steep learning curve
good game huge improvement over first version would have like to see star ruler 3
goodly
great game difficult to master

excellent game theres really nothing else like it great aesthetic very customizable easy to mod great mechanics and very fun to play can be a little complex but if you like strategy management classic scifi and having a lot of custom options this will occupy you for hours and hours
yes
this game is literally unique you might find other similar games in the genre but nothing like this if you like trying out new stuff and game mechanics give this title a chance
actually good
fun imperial space adventures
good game i still come back and play it from time to time
a steep learning curve and it gets a bit repetitive in the end game but the unique ftl options for all the races are really cool
very fun game with a great linux version
really cool take on the 4x genre the core gameplay loop is really addictive and easy to learn but there seems to be a lot of depth built off of that as well having a lot of fun learning how to play
somewhat good

one of the better gems on steam very well recommended

this is an excellent take on a sci fi rts it takes a while to wrap your head around some of the mechanics  especially the shipbuilding interface  but it is worth it in the end theres an excellent beginners guide on the quarter to three forums that will get you started i put in about a dozen hours before i found that guide and i wish i had known about it for the start
great scifi space strategy game with unique mechanics that are quite intruiguing refreshing compared to other games of the same genra
great game
fun game kind of a learning curve but a lottle research goes a long way

dont let the screenshots fool you this is one of the best 4x space games out there dont believe me try it yourself for free the devs released the games source code on github with a few minutes of googling around you can build the game yourself free of charge
very underrated 4x that has an interesting boardgamelike diplomacy mechanic

a good game once you understand what youre doing  just dont create a game thats too large  more than about 80100 worlds and six ais will lead to the game quickly slowing down and eventually becoming literally unplayable the ram limit is to be blunt unreasonably low for the kind of game that this is
complete hidden gem of a game really innovative and unique on almost every aspect of the 4x formula a great shame it got so burried as id say its a must play for anyone interested in the genre
it deserved better alot better a real feat of game development its sad to se how its team had to disband just because it never went mainstream

clever economy cool ship design extensive gameplay highly recommend

star ruler 1 was the very first game i purchased on steam it was the daily deal title for 10 and i had just joined steam to get in on that tf2 and counnter strike flood was so happy i bought and played it for hundreds of hours online and offline i have probably logged about 100 hours more then what my record says because i played in offline mode on a computer that is no longer in use now with this star ruler 2 and the dlc wake of the harolds i have many more hours to log into game play
a little outdated but great 4x game will publish a more detailed review when i can be bothered to stop playing it

great unique space rts a very refreshing take where the economy is done very differently gives a unique flow to a game and a depth that takes time to fully explore overall a must in any rts library because of its well executed uniqueness

an excellent strategy game  deep and with some brilliant twists such as the diplomancy system using the purchasing of cards and a great ship design screen with the ability to import other user designs straight into your game  i love the haunting music which suits the game and my play stryle well    on sale its a steal and at full price although id think a lot harder about a purchase id say it still merits its price
hands down the best 4x game there is and i mean that

its refreshing and different with ideas that actually dont try to somehow replicate the success of moo2 and still fail like so many other games strongly recommended for anyone looking for something new
possibly one of the best 4x games of all time vibrant and productive modding community

a very under rated game this game is as deep as civ vi but better in many many ways

nice 4x game that was not afraid to try something different from moo mechanics ringworlds for everyone

the mechanics in sr2 are amazing everything is dynamic and shifts constantly in response to events both success and failure can be right around the corner and things are rarely predictable it moves quickly and can be overwhelming for new players but it massively rewards knowledge and familiarity with the games systems  in short if you enjoy complex fluid 4x experiences you owe it to yourself to try this one out
